tool_description: Live news from 8000+ sources, with keywords, locations, and sentiments. ML and NLP insights.
name: TidalWaves News Analytics
title: TidalWaves News Analytics

api_list.name: Fetch the latest articles
api_list.description: Returns all articles from the latest batch.

optional_parameters.name: withKeywords
optional_parameters.description: Include related keywords for each article.

optional_parameters.name: withLocations
optional_parameters.description: Include related locations for each article.

api_list.name: Fetch the latest stories
api_list.description: Returns all stories from the latest batch.

optional_parameters.name: withArticles
optional_parameters.description: Include related articles (with keywords & locations) for each story.

api_list.name: Fetch article locations
api_list.description: Quick location fetch for specific article
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com/articles/id/locations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com/articles/{id}/locations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Check API health
api_list.description: Performs various system checks, such as connection to the DB and query latency, and returns the result. Use this endpoint to confirm the API is available.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com/health"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch batches

api_list.name: Fetch the latest batch
api_list.description: Useful for polling the latest data.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com/batches/latest"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tidalwaves-news-analytics2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
